inputs

Class CalculateController

  • java.lang.Object
    • inputs.CalculateController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class CalculateController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    CalculateController The controller that sends the data from the AnswerMachinePanel to Input, Calculations, and then calculates for the wanted variable
    Since:
    26/12/2015
    Author:
    Amritpal Aujla, Bryan Kristiono

      • CalculateController

        public CalculateController(Input input,
                           java.util.ArrayList<InputFieldPanel> inputFields,
                           WantedFieldPanel wantedField)
        The Default Constructor - initializes the input model, sets the values of the input fields and wanted field
        Parameters:
        input - - the input model to give the input values to
        inputFields - - the collection of input fields that contain the variable values
        wantedField - - the field that has the name of the wanted variable

      • isDoubleVariables

        private boolean isDoubleVariables(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> variables,
                                  java.lang.String wantedVariable)
        Checks if the input fields have more than one variable of the same type in them, returning true if yes and false if no
        Parameters:
        variables - - the collection of input fields containing the name of the variables the user inputs
        wantedVariable - - the name of the wanted variable that the user wants to calculate for
        Returns:
        whether there are two variables of the same type
